head.title: The Cardinal's Gift: Looking Beyond Conflicts

hedline.hl1: The Cardinal's Gift: Looking Beyond Conflicts

abstract.p: Elizabeth Holtzman letter on May 8 article recalls that despite their differences on some issues, late Cardinal John O'Connor called to cheer her up when she was subject of nasty press attacks

block.p: Re ''Personal Recollections of a Prelate in Touch With the People'' (news article, May 8):

I would like to share a special recollection of Cardinal John O'Connor that shows the measure of the man. Several years ago when I was the subject of nasty attacks in the press, the cardinal called me at home to cheer me up. He was very kind and gentle. I was deeply moved, particularly since we were not close and obviously differed on certain issues. In the end those differences didn't matter: he saw another person's plight and reached out to help.
Re ''Personal Recollections of a Prelate in Touch With the People'' (news article, May 8):

I would like to share a special recollection of Cardinal John O'Connor that shows the measure of the man. Several years ago when I was the subject of nasty attacks in the press, the cardinal called me at home to cheer me up. He was very kind and gentle. I was deeply moved, particularly since we were not close and obviously differed on certain issues. In the end those differences didn't matter: he saw another person's plight and reached out to help.
Too many of us get caught up in our differences. The cardinal's call showed how much he could look past them to our common humanity. It is a lesson all of us can take to heart.
The writer is a former member of Congress.
